column4: hi guys, I'm trying to mount an ext4 hard to Ubuntu but I'm getting: you must specify the filesystem type. This hard had ubuntu installed and I plug it, Ubuntu only mount the GRUP section of the hard. What to do please?
*when I plug it
whats the exact mount command you are using?
sudo mount /dev/sdb2 ~/Desktop/hard
give it the -t ext4 option perhaps.
I did, I got another message
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/cciss/c0d1,
you may want to pastebin the output of sudo fdisk -l also
sorry forget about that /dev/ I copied it from the net
that directory does exist?
i wouldent use the ~ and that directory 'hard' does exist? with the proper case?
yes it does
http://pastebin.com/cXDYuLm9
sdb2 is wrong.. use sdb5
uknown filesystem type LVM2_member
you got it as part of a LVM  according to fdisk.. ive never used lvm   your paste shows ------->   dev/sdb5          501760   976771071   488134656   8e  Linux LVM
so?
so how did you partion this disk? whats on it?  it dosent seem to be ext4
just mount /dev/sdb5 /whatever/hard     might work.
This was the main hard for a desktop. It have ubuntu installed. i just removed the hard from the desktop and put it in a USB box then connected it to this new machine
The new machine only mounts the grup partition. about 256mb
I know very little aboiut LVM. but fdisk says its a LVM partition. not a normal ext3/4 filesystem.
that makes sence if it has no idea what to do with the LVM.
oh I forgot to say that it was ubuntu server installed on this hard
